text: Thanks guys, appreciate the feedback. We messed around with the free trial last night and are going to be trying it out on a couple clients internally to see if it's something that will work for us. Along those lines, if anyone has any preferred tutorials or walkthroughs for configuring it for agency work, that would be much appreciated as well. We're following a few blog posts but still wrapping our heads around it
remember there is no real client facing portion of the PM
it isnt like teamwork or base camp
definitely, sorry I wasn't clear, I just meant managing our deliverables for certain clients

We're on another PM right now mainly for tracking time, but we're looking for something with some more flexibility for us to customize our processes and that we can use for more in-depth reporting (utilization rate, etc...).
You should also consider the JIRA learning curve - it’s very complex compared with basecamp and others, so you might get lots of power, but lose productivity in keeping it well manicured
<@U26BLKGE4> we’ve had success customizing and using wrike
We just moved to Asana.. so far so good. Had Jira and Teamwork in the past

I use asana for freelance projects and I find it nice. It isn't super complicated. If you understand the Jira/moving cards aspect  -- Asana works the same and doesn't have the steep learning curve as Jira
We looked at Asana a long time ago, might be worth revisiting
I felt Asana was a little too loose in some regards and the UI was missing some obvious stuff. but I’ve only used the free version
The paid version allows for some pretty great reporting and also the ability to have custom fields.
